abstract: As power shifts to consumers, propelled by the Internet and apps, many stores are scrambling to move beyond the time-worn cycle of markups and discounts — and still make money.
snippet: As power shifts to consumers, propelled by the Internet and apps, many stores are scrambling to move beyond the time-worn cycle of markups and discounts — and still make money.
lead_paragraph: P. T. Vineburgh has a sense of how much things should cost, and on a recent trip to the Boston jeweler Shreve, Crump & Low, he was not afraid to say so.

headline.main: Knowing Cost, the Customer Sets the Price
headline.print_headline: Knowing Cost, The Customer Sets the Price

abstract: Brian T. Moynihan’s 2011 pay was significantly higher than the $1.9 million payout he received in 2010. But some other executives at Bank of America made more than he did.
snippet: Brian T. Moynihan’s 2011 pay was significantly higher than the $1.9 million payout he received in 2010. But some other executives at Bank of America made more than he did.
lead_paragraph: Brian T. Moynihan, chief executive of Bank of America, earned $8.1 million in 2011, a sharp increase from the $1.9 million payout he received in 2010.

headline.main: Bank of America Chief’s Pay Jumps to $8.1 Million
